instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
[B]Hi guys,[/B]

I got a 820-01700-05 logic board that won’t turn on after wake up from sleep with no signs of burned components or water spills. It is stuck at 5v and PPBUS seems to be shorted to ground. 

PPBUS_G3H - 0.1V


In resistance mode:

PPBUS_G3H to ground: 17.7 Ohms
PPBUS_G3H to CPU coils: 18.4 Ohms
CPU coils to ground: 1.5 Ohms
PP2V5_ NAND_SSD to ground: 7.0 K Ohms

In diode mode:

CPU coils to ground: 001 
Other big coils around: 007, 003, 002, 012, 015.


Any ideas would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"PPBUS_G3H to ground: 17.7 Ohms"
Did you test with charger, or battery connected???
Allow 10-15s after power is removed, before checking diode mode, or ohm scale!

I suspect angle sensors issue.
Check U4802 signals, with lid closed/open.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Thank you 2informaticos! Happy to be here!


Well, on "PPBUS_G3H to ground", I'm getting 0 Ohms with charger and 16.5 Ohms with battery connected.
In diode mode 0.173 with charger and 0.008 with battery.

U4802 signals - Lid closed.

Pin 1 - 0.001v
Pin 2 - 0.0v
Pin 4 - 0.005v
Pin 6 - 0.0v 

U4802 signals - Lid Open.

Pin 1 - 0.006v
Pin 2 - 0.0v
Pin 4 - 0.0v
Pin 6 - 0.0v

Just in case - in resistance mode

Pin 1 - 4.23 MOhms
Pin 2 - 9.6 kOhms
Pin 4 - 50 KOhms
Pin 6 - 7.5 Ohms

Thank you!

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
As expected, your ptoblem is caused by lid signals.
Missing 1V8_SLPS2R to U4802 must be corrected.
Check the trace to other points of the same power rail.
If broken, you can run a wire.

NOT expected, to see you still checking diode mode with power on the board; STOP that!

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Ah, sorry for the newbie mistake. Would be OK if I inject 1V to the 1V8_SLPS2R rail to find the short?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: What short?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
I thought maybe a component was causing a short to ground on 1V8_SLPS2R rail? sorry, I'm still learning.

I've been checking other points of the same trail and the line seems to be broken, any ideas where I can run a wire?

Gracias!

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Do you get 1.8V on some points of that line, or nowhere?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
No, Im not getting 1.8V on that line. I was also checking voltages that U7800 outputs and nothing. May U7800 be bad? Let me know what you think.

Thanks.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
So no voltage at L7813?
Check diode mode to ground there.
Be sure R7813 has 0 ohm.
If all good, should change U7800.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
L7813
With charger: 0.0v 
Diode mode to ground: .003V
-----------------
R7813
0 Ohm.

You think reflowing the chip could be an option before replacing it?

Thank you.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Don't write end "V" after diode mode reading.
We don't want to make confusion with voltage measurment.
I hope you've got 0.003 witout charger connected.
For low values (under 0.005), switch to ohm mode.

You can try first injecting voltage.
There are many components connected, not only U7800.
Is not pure short, but an IR cam may help you to find the culprit.
Remove CPU/GPU heatsink first.
Then start injecting 1V; you can slowly increase until 2V (no more).
Set the amp limit to max first, on the lab PSU.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Got it!

Yes, I've got 0.003 without charger connected / in resitance mode: 6.1 ohms

So just to confirm, should I inject voltage to the 1V8_SLPS2R rail? 

Thank you!

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Of course, on the power rail where you have the short.
You probably can't heat anything too much, with 6 ohm resistance; unless something enters in thermal avalanche.
IR cam will help you to detect small temperature differences.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Well, the only component that is getting hot is the Apple T2 chip when voltage is injected. Could this be the issue? 

Thank you.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Bad news.
Really strange that machine still works, with only wake up issue.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Not fixable ?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: If the short is inside T2, need to change it...

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: I've been reading about this issue, if the T2 chip is bad, it can be replaceable but touch ID wont work. Is that true?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
You need to get the touch ID from the same board found the replacement T2.
If not, need to bring the machine to an official Apple service; they can pair T2 and touch ID again.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Ok, I havent gotten the T2 replacement yet but I releived the short on PP1V8_SLPS2R rail, PPBUS_G3H still shorted to ground, Any suggestion? Thanks.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
You had working board, just lid sensors problem.
How can you have short on PPBUS_G3H???

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
I know! 

PPBUS_G3H to ground: 21 Ohms. 
PPBUS_G3H to CPU coils: 21 Ohms
CPU coils to ground: 1.7 Ohms

Would be safe to inject 1V into PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode (or ohm scale) disconnecting charger and battery?
Check if any other big coil shows 17 ohm to ground.
Don't forget L9080/580.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
Yes, I did.

Im getting 1.7 Ohms only on these: L7221 / L7211 / L7231

L9080: 3.5 KOhms
L9580: 6.8 KOhms

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
So actually your board doesn't turn on.
What you did to happen this?

Be very sure no short between PPBUS_G3H and any other coil; or you can fry the board injecting voltage!

Just for refference:
L6960/61    424
L7030        501
L7211/21/31    003.2
L7330        031.8
L7410/20    009
LA710/20/30/40    003 /     8.5 ohm
LA750        004.9
LA850        032.7
LA860        041.8*
LA870        042
LA950        024.6
L7600        412
L7660        387
L7701        140
L8102        128
L8410        882       
L9020/21    467
L9030        372
L9080/81    424
L9520/21    426
L9530        373

Missing L3500, L9580 and LB700 in the listing; check them too.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
I did nothing, at the beginning I was thinking it was something related to SSD's just as many people claimed on internet. I also thought U7000 had something to do about it but it was Ok. Wasn't expecting to see PP1V8_SLPS2R shorted! That's it :).

So, for:

L6960/61: 6 Ohms
L7030: 45.2 KOhms
L7211/21/31: 1.6 KOhms
L7330: 37 Ohms
L7410/20: 26 Ohms
LA710/20/30/40: 21 Ohms
LA750: 24 Ohms
LA850: 49 Ohms
LA860: 49 Ohms
LA870: 49 Ohms
LA950: 37 Ohms
L7600: 7 KOhms 
L7660: 2.9 KOhms
L7701: 258 Ohms
L8102: 80 Ohms
L8410: 32 KOhms
L9020/21: The Ohm reading fluctuates up and down like crazy from 172 Ohm to 2.2 KOhms
L9030: 2.8 KOhms
L9080/81: 7 KOhms
L9520/21: 259 Ohms
L9530: 147 Ohms
L3500: 8 KOhms
L9580:  3.3 KOhms
LB700: 8 KOhms

Thank you!

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
I posted diode mode readings for refference; just one ohm value, for very low reading.
Why can't do the same?

However, no need to recheck.
You have now a problem with 3V3_G3H_RTC power rail.
"L6960/61: 6 Ohms"
No idea what you did there...

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
My bad. L6960/61: 15.3 Ohms, rest is Ok.

L9020/21: It reads 172 Ohm, then 2.2 KO, then 0.6 KO, back to 172 Ohms, 2.2KO, 0.6 KO...

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message:
STOP checking in ohm scale.
Switch from diode mode to ohm scale ONLY for very low values; usually under 0.005-0.010 in diode mode.

6 or 15 ohm there is bad anyway.
You should get 0.300-0.450 in diode mode; depends of the multimeter used.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Yes, I got 0.007 in diode scale. Just injected voltage into 3V3_G3H_RTC and U5104 showed up in thermal camera.

threads.title: Macbook Pro A2141 820-01700-05 Wont turn on.
threads.message: Change it then...
